Blog.post: Well where to begin... I think I will begin with one of my first memories as a child. I remember sitting on some type counter and all these girls looking at me. My sister was there and there was feathered hair all over the place. I knew we were at my sister's high school in the V building. Denise's friend were making a big fuss over me (why because I was a QT of course). For some reason I remember all of the girls wearing a deep maroon or it may have been red. I think they were all mat maids or uncoordinated cheer leaders. Well I think that is where I will stop for now. I know it isn't much but I will continue on little exercises as my blog progresses. caio!

Me: I'm not as bright as you. I'm one of the dull crayons My friend: hardly. Me: I'm a broken crayon and youâ€™re a freshly wrapped crayon. My friend: I'm one of those big fat ones for little kids Me: with a perfect point? My friend: yes! brand spanking new Me: I'm in the broken crayon bin. We hope to see the light of day sometime. I'm with the crayons that get melted into some ugly arts and crafts project. My friend: rofl Me: Oooh I am one of those flesh tone crayons. Nobody used those. I'll write an auotbiography called: "My life as a crayon: tearin' back the label" or "Broken and lovin' it" My friend: haaaaaaaaaaa! yessssssss!

Happy Halloween! Well I have received some great feedback on the costume. When I have pics available I most certainly will put them up. I am going to stop by Charles' work. He didn't pick a costume. Slacker!!!

Costume Status I am 99.9% complete with my costume. I painted my sweater and tie maroon and gold (Gryffindor). I sewed latches on my cape. I also sewed the Gryffindor emblem on the cape. I'm wearing my black slacks and black shoes. I have the white button up shirt to wear with the tie and sweater. What's left you ask? Well I forgot my wand. I didn't get a wand. How could I forget? Maybe tonight I could put something together. We shall see...

Ready for the weekend I need some time to actually rest. I have caught a little cold that is slightly annoying. I just don't want it to turn into a hinderance. Well tonight I am going to a wake. My tata's sister passed away. I knew her as Tia Annie. It isn't pronounced like you would normally pronounce Annie. It sounds more like On-knee. I loved going to her house. She lived right by Davis Elementary and there were train tracks. I loved putting pennies on the track and waiting for the train and then after the train had passed we (my cousins and I) would run to the track and look for our freshly squashed penny. It was the best. She was one of the nicest people. I pray that God gives the family peace because I know my Tata is taking it really hard. I hope that this will bring our family even closer. There are so many relatives that I don't know. I am sure that I will meet some tonight.

Long time no talk Here is a quick recap of what I did this past weekend: Saturday Class was pretty easy. I just have to email the instructor the last assignment He came out great! My sister did some major makeup on the guy. For more pics look at urlLink Operation Zelda I didn't go to my Uncle's b-day party. I wasn't feeling too good and I wanted to spend some time at my mom and dad's so Charles and I stayed there and watched a movie. Sunday I worked on my costume some more. It is coming together... slowly but surely. I took many a pictures of the party. I will post my favorite pics later

Here is my agenda for this weekend Saturday Class from 8-12 at work Going to a friends house to dress him up Go home change and go to my Uncle's surprise 60th b-day party Sunday Get up early to buy my niece a B-Day present Go to her party at Skate Country East Come home and finish crocheting my scarf
God has a sense of humor... right? I was emailed this awhile ago. I thought it would be interesting to put up.
Working Hard I am surprised at the amount of time I have invested in crocheting. I have crocheted about three and a half feet. I am very proud of myself. ;)

My friend: one time! He was sleeping on my lap, and I was tired... and I farted really loud and it woke him up Me: OMG! My friend: and he was like "what? huh?" Me: ROFL My friend: and I was like "just go back to sleep sweetie..." Me: Then he said... "you smell that? Did something die?"

Busy as a bee... Yup I have actually been busy. I know it is hard to believe. I learned how to crochet. I am putting together a Hogwart's student costume. I went to Toys R Us with AM to look for gifts for Asia. After TRU we picked up Asia from school. Then we went back to my mom's house. Dropper off Asia and picked up my mom. Went to Wal-Mart and picked up a DVD (Truth About Cats & Dogs) and some other stuff. AM got a head start on Christmas for Abram and Asia. Went back to my mom's house. Took some left over pizza (earlier from the day) and took it home to Chalres. I then put on the Harry Potter Chamber of Secrets (for motivation) and sat through the whole movie crocheting my scarf for my costume. I then went to bed about 11:30. It has been kind of hectic...

My thoughts about Kill Bill Well Charles and I went to see two movies this weekend. On Friday we went to see Kill Bill Volume 1 and on Saturday we saw Texas Chainsaw Massacre. Both were good movies. -- urlLink Kill Bill -- This is the first part of two series and it left me wanting to see more. The action scenes were great. The costumes were good. The plot was simple. My favorite part of the movie was where O-Ren Ishii (Lucy Liu) and "The Bride" (Uma Thurman) fought out side of the club in the snow. It was just as if the snow falling was timed with the music. It was excellent. My favorite character was Go Go Yubari (Chiaki Kuritama). She was O-Ren Ishii's bodyguard. She was a bad mofo! I wish there was more of her in the movie. There is always a least favorite character in the movie. In this one it would have to be Sofi Fatale (Julie Dreyfus). I can't put my finger on it but there was something about her that really annoyed me. I might have to watch it again just to find out ;)
Learning some stuff here... I am actually learning some things here about html. I know folks... this blog is very basic but I am just learning how to use html. Can't you just be happy for me?

AM's Lack of Short-Term Memory So where to begin. I have so many examples at my disposal. The exact times and dates of the events I can not recall (do I suffer from this as well?). But I think this will be a regular segment of my blog. Going forward it will be called AM's STM. Example 1 -- Last week AM was looking for a costume for my niece Asia. She found a Yoda and I told AM, my sister, that she needs something brown to wear underneath. I proceeded to give her several examples such as a t-shirt or a sweater. What does AM say? "How about a white turtleneck?" My poor chuck...

Back for more Wow has it been over a month? I'm sorry I did try to start a blog at other sites but it didn't work out. I do however want to include a post from my journal I started at the other site because I think I should share it with you. Here it is: There was a discussion today about the worst Halloween costumes you wore as a kid. I am embarrassed to say... I won. You remember the California Raisin fad? Yes... it is true... I was a California Raisin. My costume consisted of black tights, white gloves, a black garbage bag and many wadded up newspapers. I will let you use your imagination on how this ended up. All I can remember is how much I had to use the restroom and if I took off the tie at the bottom all the papers would come off.

Weekend Synopsis Friday night Charles and I hung out and relaxed. Saturday I did loads and loads of laundry. Then while Charles went to work, I met my mom at Gordo's for lunch. We were there for about an hour and a half just talking. It was nice. She said that she misses me. Awwww. Later Charles and I went to my parent's house for a nice friendly game of Mexican Train. My mom is quite the competitor. She has the double 15 dominos set that take 3 hours to play through. Once we are over with the game she immediately wants to start over. Charles and I look at each other with bloodshot eyes (it was already midnight), but we played on. Instead of starting at 15 we started on 6s. It was fun. My mom won. After our long night, Charles and I slept in. My family came over and brought a bucket of chicken from KFC. My dad helped Charles turn on the heater. They left and Charles and I then headed over to Jenny's house. Mike and her just bought a new tv and needed help lifting it. We chatted for a bit and left to run some errands and then returned home. It was a great weekend.

TGIF... It seems as the year draws to an end, the weeks go by faster. I swear it was just Friday. What are my plans for this weekend? Let me check my calendar... oh look NOTHING! I think Charles and I are just going to take it easy this weekend. Probably clean house and that's about it. I am sure Charles will have to work tomorrow. Hopefully not too long. The only thing I have to look forward to is laundry. Our laundry basket runneth over. I didn't realize it had been so long since I last washed. I guess I should have realized it was bad when putting clothes in the leaning tower of laundry has become a game. How so you ask? I compare it to playing Jenga. For anyone who has lived under a rock, Jenga is a game of stacked pieces. The object is to remove a piece and add it back on the top without making the whole pile fall. That is how my laundry is right now. I remove a piece of clothing such as socks and skillfully add them to the pile of laundry and I get excited if I don't make the leaning tower of laundry topple over. I celebrate my 'non-topple' silently in fear that Charles might catch on with my own little game.

Last class tonight... Yup it's true. Tonight is the last week for Human Resources Management. The instructor is actually pretty good. Ooh that reminds me I need to fill out the course evaluation. I'm so glad there are no papers due this week. The only thing that will be due is the final and it was a piece of cake. Next week I have off. Why you ask? Thanksgiving of course. Which reminds me... I have to cook a ham for next week. Last year when I was given 'ham duty' I resorted to a Honey Baked Ham. It was quite tasty, but my Mom refuses to accept a Honey Baked Ham. She wants me to cook it myself. ::gasp:: That is quite an undertaking.

Baby Shower Stuff... I'm starting to gather stuff for my sister's baby shower. There are so many sites with information on it. I took a stab at the guest list and there are roughly 30-35 people total. I think my house can handle that... hopefully.

Good deed for the day... I'm not sure if you remember the movie urlLink Teen Witch . It was a great 80's movie/musical. Come to find out that Molly shares the same love for this movie. I was able to find some samples of the songs and Molly was really excited and fowarded them to her sister. Molly's sister: YAYAYAYYYAAA Molly's sister: O JESUS I am DYING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Molly's sister: How can I ever thank you enough. Molly: it was all delisa's doing Molly's sister: Well, you give her a big stick figure high five for me, ok?

Weekend Synopsis Friday Charles and I relaxed and watched movies. Saturday Went to Asia's soccer game (it was a tie game) and then to Peter Piper Pizza with her and the team. Went to Walgreen's and picked up a gift bag for my cousin's first b-day. It was nice we hung out with Becky, Adrian, Tia Mary, Uncle Arnold, Ronnie, Melissa and Becky's parents. Her parents were making me laugh. They are a hoot. There was some kid riding around on a scooter and Becky's dad, Charles and I were absolutely mesmerized by this little scooter. Everytime we heard it we got excited and said things like 'Here it comes! Here it comes!', 'I think I see it'. Becky's dad stopped the kid and wanted to get the details about the bike. We were all under the impression that the bike holds like 150 pounds and goes about 20mph at top speed. Boy were we wrong. 500 pounds with a top speed of 40mph. WOW! The kid I'm sure was a little intimidated. I'm sure he couldn't have been older than 13-14 and here are 3 adults surrounding him like kids at an ice cream truck. After answering our questions he drove into the sunset. Left the party to go grocery shopping and to Target. Molly, Dina and Teddy came over. We played Pictionary, Mexican Train, and some other games. I learned that I can not play the game BS. I am absolutely horrible at it. I think Molly won all the times we played. Molly stayed till about 11:30pm. Dina and Teddy left about midnight or so. I was so proud of how my dogs behaved. I was worried they would try to bite Molly. but after Pixie barked at her a few times and gave her a good introductory sniff, all was good. We had Raspberry Vodka and Lemonade. That is some good stuff but way too dangerous. Charles wasn't feeling well yesterday. Good Times!! Sunday Charles and I drove to Phoenix and picked up Jan (Charles' mom) at the airport. Then drove her to the Four Seasons in Scottsdale. It was a really nice place. I'm sure they sell timeshares. We ate lunch at a outdoor restaurant. I had Albondigas and Charles had Posole. Jan had a Diet Coke (she was eating later with her co-workers). The Albondigas were good but it was 7 bucks for about a cup size of soup. After spending some time with her in the room, we then left and stopped at In/Out for some burgers and fries. All in all I had a fun weekend.

Honorary Member I go to Molly's blog and I see: The Club Well, I think I made a boo boo. Last night, I told Delisa I thought she "looked like a chola" in her work ID photo. Then I quickly recanted with, "Oh I can't say that, can I? I'm not in the club." Delisa, who takes EVERYTHING in stride, said, "Well I can make you an honorary member! Your code name will be 'La Guera!'" OUT-freeking-STANDING! My response? To correct your statement I actually said 'honorary beaner'.

My sissa is coming! My sissa is coming! Yup that is right. My sister from Montana is coming the second week of December. I'm really excited. She is due February 22nd. So we have to have a baby shower for her. It will be a lot of fun.
IM with a friend... Me: Want to see Tupac: Resurrection? Someone: uhhh Me: I was kidding. I would rather stick red hot pokers in my eyes. Someone: Good. Then we can remain friends.

Weekend Synopsis I went to Asia's game Saturday morning. After the game I took her and Abram to go eat. After eating, we went to the parking lot of a local mall and I was teaching Abram how to drive. It was fun and he did pretty good too. Saturday evening we saw two movies. Elf and Scary Movie 3. Elf was great! Will Ferrill was awesome in this movie. Scary Movie 3 was awful. I really didn't want to see it however Charles wanted to see it. It was a 'double feature' night. We paid for Elf and saw Scary Movie 3 for free. . When the movie was over and we were walking to the car, Charles quietly said "at least we didn't spend anything to see that movie". I should have said I did because I spent way too much time in that theatre. Sunday I had to come to work to finish up on a project. Then went home and played some PS2. It was great.

Pen Pal I'm really excited. I received my packet yesterday about being a pen pal for kids in Washington DC. I have two assignments before I am given a group of pen pals. The first is to write an introductory letter. The second is to create a visual profile. I think I will have to work on that later today. Molly first introduced me to the in2books.org and I'm really looking forward to writing the letters. I've never had a pen pal and I think that this is a great opportunity to help kids. PLUS I spend way too much time playing PS2 and I was going to start volunteering anyway. Thanks for the lead Molly!

Friday Well I made it through another week. School was good yesterday. Notice I didn't say great. It would have been great if Molly went but it was good. The teacher kept us til about 9:30pm. This teacher is holding my attention. In fact he has been throwing a wrench on Molly's ability to tell when I lose attention. How so? Well let me tell you. At the start of each class Molly will write down the time that she thinks I will lose my interest in the class lecture. Of course she doesn't show me the time. She has quite the ability for prognostication. So the deal is if I reach for something and start 'doodling' or grab for something in my backpack to keep me entertained the time is 'marked'. She had it down to 2 minutes once...

School Tonight Well tonight I have school and I begged for Molly to come but she isn't. How am I supposed to get through this class without her entertaining me with her living comic strip? She said that she included new scenes in the comic strip. Well hopefully I can get through the class.

Voting I am so bad. I completely forgot to vote yesterday. I had even read up on the current propositions and filled out the voter's brochure so I could take it with me. CRAP!!! I know this is bad I am admitting it to you but I have never voted before. I think that's why I was so gung-ho about voting this time around. I did my research too. I feel awful now.

Blog Status Not that I get any readers, but I am changing the style of my blog. Puke green was starting to get on my nerves. You may notice that past posts do not match current posts. I also lost several posts but what can you do? I am still learning html. Ta ta for now!

Someone: There should be hundreds of people and presents. Me: No one should have a gift less than $20â€¦ oops. I think I left out a â€˜0â€™. Someone: If people don't love me enough to use their credit cards, then they don't belong there. Me: Exactly. Someone: I'm glad we're on the same track.
My weak attempt in photo editing Here I am the Gryffindor...

Frodo vs. Potter So as you are aware I was a Hogwart's student in the Gryffindor House. For you muggles, that is from Harry Potter. I was really proud of my costume. Not only did I learn how to crochet and finish my first 6 foot scarf in less than a week, I also sewed on my latches and patch on my cape AND I painted my sweater trims to match the Gryffindor House colors (Maroon and Gold). I wanted to share my accomplishment with a friend at work, I shall call her Cheri ;-) So I go to Cheri like a little kid all excited to share my creation. Imagine a 5 year old showing a freshly colored stick figure family portrait and the pride that goes with them sharing it. I am positive I had a cheesy smile that went from ear to ear. My friend Cheri goes..."Ooh Lord of the Rings". My smile immediately faded and I replied with disgust "ahhh..no". Needless to say I walked away feeling totally defeated by her lack of pop culture knowledge.

I know I know... Yes it has been awhile. Can you believe it has almost been two weeks? I'm so sorry. So what have I been up to? Like everyone else in the world... I am getting ready for Christmas. I am already done with shopping. I finished a couple of days ago.

The Last Samurai This movie was great. To be perfectly honest I am not a big Tom Cruise fan but he was great in urlLink The Last Samurai . Charles mentioned a few times during the movie "those are my brothers". He had also mentioned that he now wants a samurai sword with his mom's maiden name 'Watanabe'. I told him I can see him playing around with the sword and cutting off a major appendage. He said he promised he would be careful.

Dinner and a movie Last night Charles and I ate a Gavi's which I thought was spelled Gabe's. Molly informed me that I was not spelling it correctly. If Gabe is pronounced in spanish it sounds the same as Gavi. Oh well... The portions of food at Gavi's were hearty and dee-li-cious. I ordered lasagna, Charles ordered stuffed eggplant and for our appetizer we had creamy calamari. I have leftover lasagna for lunch. Yummy! After dinner we met my parents, Denise and Abram at World Market (I think it is called Cost Plus). Abram had way too much flavored coffee from there. He was talking way too fast for me to understand. I had to keep reminding him to stay still around all the breakable items in the store. After the store we decided to go see The Last Samurai at Park Place (the mall). When we got to the mall we had about 20 minutes to spare before the movie started so we walked around a bit. I needed to get more lotion (Plumeria) from Bath & Body Works and Charles needed to go to KB Toys. Abram was still buzzing off his coffee in Bath & Body Works shop; he was actually jumping up and down. I lightly grabbed his chin and told him to settle down. We met Charles in KB's and he found Star Wars figures. After he bought them we met my parents and Denise and went to the movies to see The Last Samurai.

3 Years Today Charles and I will celebrate our 3 year wedding anniversary. I can't believe it has already been 3 years. Charles showed up at work to hand deliver me flowers but I missed him. He gave me white roses which are my favorite. Such a great guy. We may go eat later tonight. We may eat at Caruso's which is my favorite restaurant.

Weekend Synopsis Friday... I can't even remember what I did Friday. Oh yeah. Charles and I went to the Casino. We played the penny machines and spent about $20. Not bad for a couple of hours. We didn't win anything. Oh well. Saturday... Charles and I cleaned house and then lounged around. We later got ready and then went to my mom's house and played some games. Afterwards we went to pick up Denise at the airport about 10pm. She looked so cute with her little mommy belly. After picking up Denise we went straight to Mi Nidito. She loves to eat there and wanted good Mexican food. Back at home (Missoula, MT) there isn't much Mexican food except Taco Bell. Sunday... The baby shower was on Sunday. The food was great and we laughed a lot. It was fun. I took plenty of pictures. I will have to get them to Denise.

Class & Weekend Plans Last night's class was aight. The instructor is interesting. We have a new group member that seems really enthusiastic. So this class will should be fine. I'll keep my fingers crossed. Tonight we might go to a basketball game. Saturday Denise comes in the evening and Sunday is the Baby Shower. I am really excited to see Denise. She should be showing by now.

Class Tonight I have class tonight. Ugh. I haven't even started the paper. Ok so I did start the paper. I changed the standard cover sheet to the class name, the new instructor, and date. That's all! I will have to start working on it. Why do I always wait until the last minute? This is the last class that I have with Molly at the UofP. Awwww. Hopefully we will still take the Art History class at Pima. We shall see.

Drive By Chocolate Strange. I got back to my desk earlier and there was a big chocolate bar on my seat. It is one of those fundraiser chocolates that was left at my desk. I wonder who it is from? Maybe my secret santa. I don't want to sound rude but I am not much of a chocolate person. I know Charles will love it. Wait a minute. What if it was left at my desk by mistake? Ok this is what I will do. I will leave it at my desk for the remainder of the week. It will be right by my keyboard. In case someone 'forgot' it. However when I leave on Friday it is going home with me and it will make Charles a happy man.

Tuna Fried Rice That's what we had for dinner yesterday. It is simple to make and it is yummy. Charles and I ate dinner, then we played poker. We played Texas Hold Em, Follow the Queen, Baseball, Flying V, Low Ball, 7 card No-Peek, and plain old poker. While playing we watched Bubble Boy. urlLink Bubble Boy is an okay movie. There is this midget named Beetlejuice. Charles thinks this midget is funniest thing in the world. Why? I have no idea. I personally like the Bright and Shiny people (cult) and their leader is Gil played by Fabio. Like I said... an ok movie.

Email Chat... Someone: Somehow, I'm going to have to find a way to recapture the joy in the challenge of my job!! Me: Go to work blindfolded. It would be a new adventure everyday. Someone: Plus, it would sharpen my other senses! Me: Exactly!

Long Weekend Synopsis As you know this past weekend was Thanksgiving. Here is what I did on each day: Thursday -- Woke up at 8 to start the ham. Yup that is right I did the ham. Pineapple, ground cloves, brown sugar and the ham is all you need. It came out great. The feast was great. I love the way my mom makes yams and her 18 pumpkin pies. Sooooo gooood. After dinner we reviewed the ads for Black Friday. Charles and I had decided the only place we were going to stop was Best Buy. Friday -- Charles parents came in at about 3am. I know they were exhausted. They flew from South Carolina to LAX. They were there to see their son, Matthew, graduate from the Army National Guard. As soon as they got in they went home for about an hour to re-pack and then drove to Tucson. I woke up at about 4am to get ready for the Best Buy shopping. Which was absolute madness. The lines were long to get in and to pay. The good thing is that we were only in the store for about 2 hours tops. Later that day we went to the Casino. I broke even and so did Charles. Saturday -- We relaxed and then got ready. We went to this candy store and bought a crapload of Mexican candy for dirt cheap. It was like I was in Nogales. We also bought a jar of hot pickles. Jan and Chuck made dinner for everyone. My parents, Dina and the kids and Angel all came over for dinner. Then later we played Mexican train. Another great evening. Sunday -- Chuck and Jan left at about 1130. Charles and I went to JCPenney soon after. They were having a great sale and Charles received a 20% off coupon. I haven't bought new clothes in awhile so I was quite excited.

No gym yesterday or the day before that There has been so much going on that I haven't been able to go. School, Family, Family and more Family. Of course I have to make up the time. I need to go and keep it up. I got way too much junk in the trunk that I need to get rid of.

Email comedy... SINGLE BLACK FEMALE seeks male companionship, ethnicity unimportant. I'm a very good looking girl who LOVES to play. I love long walks in the woods,riding in your pickup truck, hunting, camping and fishing trips, cozy winter nights lying by the fire. Candlelight dinners will have me eating out of your hand. Rub me the right way and watch me respond. I'll be at the front door when you get home from work, wearing only what nature gave me. Kiss me and I'm yours. Call (404) 875-6420 and ask for Daisy. Over 15,000 men found themselves talking to the Atlanta Humane Society about an 8-week old black Labrador retriever. Men are so easy.

Just Say No To Salt Awhile ago Charles and I went to a little Ice Cream shop where the sold Mexican Candy and boy did we stock up. One of the many items we purchased was a huge jar of hot pickles. Well now all the pickles are gone BUT the juice is still there. I bought some saladitos and put soaked them in some of the remaining juice from the hot pickles. It was yummy. I took one for Molly to try. I carefully plucked one from its sisters and brothers then gently wrapped it in foil. I get to the gym and some of the juice leaks out and I smell like a pickle the rest of the night. I'm waiting to talk to Molly to see how soon she tossed it.

What a Day Well my sister received her test results today. It looks like she might have to have surgery. I'm not sure if this is bad but I try not to think about it because it scares me. I don't understand why some people have had to go through so much crap and others through practically nothing. I know it is part of life blah blah blah. Don't get me wrong, I don't wish bad on other people but I can't help to compare.

Sunday Let's see... I worked out with Molly. After working out I went home and got ready. Charles and I went to Wal-Mart. I really don't like to go to Wally's during the day especially on the weekend. It is always so packed. After Wally's we drove to Albertson's. While on the way there, my energy meter went to E. I couldn't even keep my eyes open. It was kind of strange. So I told Charles I would stay in the car while he shopped. Sometimes it is fun being in the car and watching people walk by and they have no idea that someone is watching them. I think I saw about 10 people pick their nose. When we got home from the grocery store we made dinner and then I played some PS2. I think I fell asleep a few times while I was playing. I went to bed about 730 and slept like a baby until 6am. It was nice.

What a great um... good... er um day today is Well my day isn't all that bad. I went to work out today with Molly. Rode the bike for 40 minutes and then worked on back and abs. I then went home and got ready. I got ready to come to work... yup that's right. I am at work right now working on a project. I actually don't mind so much because Charles is working right now too. Plus if I didn't have work to come to I would just be home playing with my new MP3 player. Yup that's right your looking at (sorry reading the words from) a Nomad Zen Jukebox owner. 30 gigs of what ever type of music my little heart desires. We went to Best Buy and I asked the guy about the Creative Nomad and his reply kind of upset me... "oh the one that's been out of stock for the past 3 weeks?". I think from the expression of disgust on my face he realized that he was rude and then quickly apologized. "I'm sorry that was a little rude of me wasn't it?" I just looked at Charles and we left the guy standing there. So we headed over to Circuit City and low and behold ONE LEFT!!! The price tag showed $269.99 but I know that Circuit City website had it for $219.98 and asked about price matching. So after he 'made a call' I bought the MP3 player for about $280 with the extended warranty because it only comes with a 3 month warranty and it is the first one I've owned so I didn't want to take ANY chances.

LMAO Class yesterday was interesting. First night of class and I think my instructor is challenged. She will talk and then laugh for no apparent reason. Her outfit for the evening consisted of a colorful vest with a black blouse underneath. She then wore a black skirt cut to the knee AND then she wore black knee high stockings. I felt so bad for her when she sat down and you could see where her stockings ended. I had to really concentrate on not laughing out loud when I saw that. Molly isn't in the class so it will not be nearly as entertaining.

Routine Yes I am getting into a routine here. Besides the normal eat, work, sleep, school cycle I am throwing in the gym. That's right after much procrastination I have officially become a member of a local gym. I work out with Molly. So far so good. I am working out Saturday through Wednesday. The only day that I don't work out with Molly is on Wednesday because she has class. Going from never working out to working out 5 times a week wasn't as hard as I thought it would be. I am commited to doing it for at least a year since that is how long the contract is for anyway.

Remember Me? Yes I know this is so bad. I started this and should commit to an entry once a day or at the very least once a week day. So let's see... what have I been up to? Since the 23rd (the last time I posted) Christmas and New Year's have come and gone. I was in Orlando from 12/26 to 1/5. It was neat being there for New Year's but nothing beats my parent's house. I couldn't believe all the people that were in Orlando. It was so packed. I guess waiting for 3 hours for a single ride should have been an indicator. Friday Ugh... I didn't go to the gym yesterday but I did spend money at the casino. I did pretty good by winning 50.

Group meeting I went to school about 530pm to get a room for our group to meet at 6pm. I figured I would go early not only to get a room but also to start working on the final exam. So there were three people who had asked if I was leaving. Then the fourth person came in and said, "oh are you leaving?" I said no. "Well we signed up this room" "I've been here since 530 in this room. What am I supposed to do leave my stuff alone and go down and sign up" "Well you know the rules" I could have smaked her. There is not a 'sign up' sheet for rooms at the UofP. All they have is a stupid white board and it's a courtesy not a requirement. Stupid old lady. Well by this time it was 6 and I told her I would wait 10 minutes for my group. If they didn't show up she could have the room. I should have camped there for the rest of the night even if my group didn't show up.

Pinky Swear Terms and Conditions Me: what happens if for some reason one of the individuals that did pinky swear lost that pinky in a freak accident. Molly: My thought is.... Molly: If the pink is lost at the point of Swear Impact or lower, then the swear remains valid. Happy Hair Day Went to the beauty salon to beautify my hair. The plan was to have my hair cut, highlighted and styled. The place was packed. Well sitting there playing tetris on my PDA, I noticed 5 girls walk in all have the highlights I wanted. So that was out. The three of us (Denise, Dina and I) were supposed to have our hair done by the main beauty person girl lady. She was bilingual so I knew I had a decent chance of having Dina explain what to do to my hair. Why her you ask? Because I have no idea how to 'talk shop' to the beauty people. Well I didn't get to go with the bilingual beauty girl. I went with a Spanish speaking lady. She's talking to me and I just smiled and laughed when she did. This was all while she was washing my hair. Then I knew she asked me a question because she just looked at me and waited. So I did my best, "no speako spanisho" for her and she got someone to start translating for me. I was okay with this... I knew I had a shot. So she gave me a brush and asked me (according to the translator) to brush out my hair. Okay easy enough. So I brushed out my hair and Denise came over and said that they were rescheduling their hair appointments to next Wednesday. At this point I just wanted to leave. Well the beauty lady finished cutting my hair she asked (again according to the translator) if I wanted to have my hair styled. I told her no its ok. I will just do it at home. It came out to $20 and I gave her $10 tip. I know 50% tip, what was I thinking? She was nice and my hair did come out decent. I probably won't have my hair cut for another 2-3 years. At least I got 1 out of the three (cut, color, and style) that I wanted. What made the day is having sweet bread from the local 12th Avenue bakery. I love me some Pan Dulce. Well enough for now...

Random Memory #41798 I'm at Roskruge Middle School in 8th grade. The girls proceed to tell me if I want to be in their 'club' that they would have to initiate me. Thinking about it now that is what gang members did to their new members. So they talked to Sara and me about it at soccer practice (all the cool girls played soccer). I didn't really care so of course I said fine and so did Sara. So how did one get initiated you ask? They told me about 5 minutes before the initiation started. This took place in the girl's shower room (in the basement). There were about 8 girls besides Sara and myself. They said in order to be in their club they would have to fight us. So 4 girls against Sara and 4 girls against me. The sheep that I am... I said fine. I remember a girl that was supposed to be my best friend (not Sara) said she already went through the initiation the previous week... right. Back to the fight. There were 4 girls surrounding me and all I remember were two of the girls names: Reinah and Michelle. The so called leader of the group was Laura. Laura said she would say go and the fight would begin. She even said she would count backwards from 5. 5-4-3-2... I remember looking at tile on the ground and thinking how dirty it was and I hope I don't fall on the floor. I also remember looking at Laura as she whispered something to my best friend and they looked at me and laughed. 1.... go! Reinah and Michelle started hitting me but it didn't hurt. She was small and Reinah was about my size. I punched Reinah a few times but then backed away and just let them hit me. I didn't want to hurt Michelle because she was so much smaller than me. I didn't want to hit Reinah because she was my 'friend' and I didn't want to hurt her. As quickly as it started... it stopped. Everyone was silent as we walked out of the showers. I remember changing and asking Reinah if I hurt her when I punched her those couple of times. She said it hurt a little. Why I brought this up I don't know. Like the title says random memory.

Flag Quiz At church the other night I saw that they had flags up from different nations and I realized how awful I am at geography. Not only do I have a weakness for identifying flags but my knowledge on history is awful as well. UGH... I decided to take a Flag Quiz. Irelands history tidbit was "This flag is from Ireland, which is also the setting of the Great Famine of 1845-1850. Over one million people died in Ireland when the potato crops became diseased." I really suck at history. BUT come one honestly I knew the flag they were showing was either from Italy or Ireland. They are both using basically the same colors. Can you tell the difference? Didn't think so! Yeah yeah yeah... one is red and one is orange. BUT THEY ARE SOOO CLOSE!!!
