Quarterly Dinner Last night Dina invitied me to be her date to the Quarterly Sales Dinner. In order to qualify you have to have been the top in four sales metrics in your particular department. I'm so proud of her. She did it!! The dinner was held at Westin La Paloma. Of course the place is beautiful. When we arrived we were met by several co-workers. One of the gals from work and I went out onto the terrace. We both looked by the pool and noticed there was a ping pong table set up. We both agreed if things got to boring we would sneek out to the ping pong table. The seating was assigned. Which I usually don't mind. It gives you a chance to mingle. Usually when there is assigned seating I sit in the back with some Sales Agents. But nooooo... instead I sit right up front next to the Director and Senior VP. That was interesting. We chatted a lot, had dinner, drinks, then the awards presentation proceeded. Afterwards all was said and done... we went home. I didn't even get to play ping pong.

I got my license I was able to drive myself to work today. Yippee. Yesterday Charles picked me up from work and then we drove to my parents house. We picked up our family portraits from when the big chuck was in town with the I-Man. The off to the grocery store and home. Charles and I watched some junk on the tv. I was bored out of my mind and so I went to our game closet and dusted off the dominos for some Mexican Train. Charles beat me by about 400 points. I will get my revenge soon.

Redeye Charles brought me to work today since I can't really drive. It really sucks having this eye condition. I couldn't keep my eyes open too long. The sun just hurts my eyes like heck. Yesterday was like an adventure. I couldn't keep both eyes open when I tried to drive to work so I had to take turns... 'camera one, camera two, camera one, camera two'. I didn't want to go through that again today that's why Charles brought me. I hope tomorrow I can drive myself to work.

The waiting room I love going to the Dr's office. It's my favorite. Usually I'm in and out in less than 30 minutes. Today is a different story. My appointment was for 11am. Whenever I go to the doctor I try to be at least 10 minutes early. Today I arrived at 1055 and the waiting room was full of elderly people. About five of them would go on a coughing marathon and then moan really loud afterwards. About 30 minutes into the coughing symphony, my name was called. I felt like a million bucks. I was overfilled with joy and on the inside I was celebrating like I just made a touchdown in the Super Bowl. I went through the whole triage: height, weight, blood pressure, shoe size, etc. Then the continuation of the waiting game in the examination room. About 20 minutes later the Doc came in and apologized for the wait. Then looked at my eyes and asked me a series of questions. Come to find out my corneas are scratched from wearing my contacts. He told me to see my eye doctor before I wear my contacts again, which after going through this I probably won't.

The Rage is Back Woke up this morning and found my eyes were red again. It is the freaking contacts it just has to be. I don't know what else it could be. I rested my eyes until 11am and then got ready. Charles and I went to the movies and had every intention to see Shrek 2 but shows were sold out. Instead we watched Van Helsing... yawn. I fell alseep a few times. Let's just say Charles refers to the moving as Van Helstink. I will never get those couple hours back from my life... never.

Saturday Shindig Last night Charles and I went to Molly's going away party. IT WAS A BLAST!! First of all the party was at Erick and Michelle's house (what a nice house). Their son is such a cutie and a ball of energy. Apparently while everyone was having a great time Cole was battling huge bad guys. I didn't know what a big deal it was until he said he was on level four. Cole saved the house... and the entire world! Then the Dance Dance Revolution pads came out. Molly went head to... er um I meant foot to foot with practically everyone. As someone at the party said it was a "dance duel to the death" and someone else shouted, "death by dancing". It was just amazing. I was challenged but respectfully declined. You see I'm not that coordinated. I'm lucky I can breathe and do anything else at the same time. Molly was quite the dancing queen. After Molly boogie downed all her challengers, we hung out for awhile. Then left for home. I thaked Charles for going. He originally said he was too tired but he decided to join me anyways. He even had a good time. I only have one regret... I didn't take a camera but I'm sure there were enough cameras that I will see a couple of pics eventually.

Ms. Ross? Last night Charles and I joined my sister, Terri and her daughter Monica at Old Pueblo Grill. I had a couple of Fat Tires and Charles attempted to some sort of margarita that was waaaaaay to strong. He couldn't drink it. The topic of conversation was fun. Dina and Terri went to high school together and reminisced about those days. Little did I know that before Denise or Dina went out, their chores had to be completed. Denise and Dina had a 'chore' to brush out my hair after I took a bath. I didn't remember at all. Terri said she witnessed this event time and time again. She said they used to part my hair in the middle and each of them would take a side. My head would go this way and that. Just to give you an idea of my hair... I would be called Ms. Diana Ross by my sisters growing up. The memory was a great laughing piece for all. After Old Pueblo Grill we went to the Harley-Davidson because of a car show that was being held there. My Uncle David bought a 69 Impala a couple weeks ago and entered it into th show. Everything in the car was stock and it looked nice. After the car show we went to Kon Tiki's for about an hour and then came home.

Gripe #41248 This one isn't that big a deal but I just thought I would mention it. I was walking down the hall at work today and realized that I don't take up much room because I usually walk along the wall. I came to this realization because this lady was walking towards me with another 'walkmate' and didn't move out of my way. Mind you had I been walking down the middle of the hall I would move. But I was walking along the wall and she was walking in the middle. Well maybe not in the middle but if I had to divide the hall into 'walkable' places, there would be 5 sections. Sections 1 and 5 are along the walls and section 3 would be in the middle. I was in section 5 and she in 4. I can't go anywhere... where did she want me to move? There was no one in sections 1 and 2... she could have moved. Ahhhhh!!! I realize the above was just ranting and raving, but I feel much better now.

Eclipse and lip gloss I went to the store today. I realized that I forgot to get a gift bag for Molly. So I went to the store and bought some Eclipse mints (my new favorite) and a gift bag and tissue paper. Afterwards I went back to the house to pick up Molly's gift and put them in the bag. Molly's gift is different types of lip glosses. There were some flavors that I didn't even know existed. I know one of them was 2000 Cookies. Being that they were lip glosses I know I couldn't leave them out too long because... of course they would melt. So I had to time it just right. I left the house about 4:40. I thought it would take me a lot longer to get to Molly's place but I was there about 4:50. I know Molly gets out of work at 5:00. So I waited until 5:00 in my car. Dropped them off and left. It was kind of like Mission Impossible. Okay... maybe not but that theme song was playing in my head well I was waiting.

That's my song... I was just thinking about the songs that my dad picked out for his girls. Dina's song is "Always" and Denise's song is "That's All". My song is "Daddy's Little Girl". I then started thinking about if I ever had a munchkin, what my song to him or her would be. I have some front runners of course: "If This World Were Mine" by Marvin Gaye featuring Tammi Terrell "Ain't No Mountain High Enough" by Marvin Gaye featuring Tammi Terrell Of course I have plenty of time to think about it.

Swooosh Today I bought tickets to see Phoenix Mercury. I'm so excited to see Ms. Diana Taurasi play for Mercury. I think it will be awesome. Charles and I will see three games. One of the games is against the LA Sparks. It will be awesome to see the best Center... I'm talking about Lisa Leslie. Oooh oooh... plus Teresa Weatherspoon is an awesome guard. Charles and I will see three games. One is against the Sparks like I said earlier. The two others are against Shock (2003 WNBA Champs) and Fever (Ebony Hoffman AKA Big Dog graduated with Charles' brother).

Case of the Mondays Work was the usual stuff... blah blah blah. After work I went home and played with Pixie and Bo for awhile before going to school. I didn't even do my assignment. When I talked to the instructor about not turning in the assignment she said I could turn it in today for full credit. That will be easy enough.

Sunday Today I slept late. I went to bed about 1030pm and slept until 9am. I guess the moving wore me out. After laying around and being lazy and watching Big Fish I got ready to meet my parents. Charles and I met my parents, Dina and the kids at Outback. Then we came home to watch Kill Bill V1.

Moving Day Moving day started promptly at 930am and ended about 3:30pm. It was so hot and moving my cousin into her apartment was no easy task. She had a second floor apartment. Ahhh! I guess it could have been worse. The apartments were three stories and she could have picked a penthouse suite.

Moving On Up... Last night Dina, Abram, Asia, Charles and I saw Troy. It was decent. Now I have to go back and read Homer's Iliad to really see how accurate it was. Plus I'm done with the book Angels & Demons by Dan Brown so I have to read something else. Later today I am going to help my cousin move. We will see how that goes.

One Mic I left work about 5pm yesterday. Ugh!!!! Charles was supposed to go to orientation at University of Phoenix. He wasn't feeling up to it so he blew it off. That gave us some time to spend together.We went to eat some wings and hamburgers. Afterwards we went to Target and Albertson's. We need needed to get some supplies at Target. One of the items we needed to purchase was a mop. Well we strolling around Target I kept taking the mop and talking into the top of it like it was a mic. Then I would put it down and ask Charles a question. When he started talking I grabbed my 'mic' and put it in his face, then he would stop talking. I played this game longer than I'd like to admit. It was funny. Then while we were in the checkout line I tried it again. He finally gave me the 'no comment' line. My last try... I asked him to please say something into the mic. He then said "Testes, testes, 1-2-3". It was hilarious.

Coffee Update It is 10am and I haven't had my cup of happiness yet. Ugh. I have a headache. I am sure I will be getting the shivers soon. I think these are symptoms of withdrawl. In other news...I went back to the gym last night. It was the first time in about 5 weeks. It felt great.

The "other" factor... While at the gym, I asked Molly about the 'pee' posting. She mentioned length of pee. Which in thinking about it now I guess I would have to clearly define what I mean by 'length'. For example, a woman walks into the stall... we do not start the timer yet. You hear her unzip or detangle herself... we do not start the timer yet. And I am purposely saying she... I don't remember the last time I was in a men's restroom. (Well I do but story for a different time.) The start time would be the first instance the act of peeing is actually audible to the time it stops. Now... combine that with what I posted earlier about torque. That could be quite a game. The perfect example of this is the movie A League of Their Own. Jimmy Dugan (Tom Hanks' character) goes into the ladies locker room for the first time and starts to pee. Mae (played by Madonna) times him (although it isn't quite when he starts) and at the end of the peeing fest she says, "That's good some good peeing".

Not that best subject.. but oh well. I walked into the bathroom and while I was using the facilities (#1 if you must know). There was a herd of women in that came into use the bathroom. I was listening to all the ways that women pee. I'm sure it has something to do with volume of pee and pressure one exerts, this in turn affects the velocity at which pee impacts the toilet. All I'm saying is that there was quite a lot of torque for some and not so much for others. Okay enough of this subject.

Speakin of Coffee I found some "You know you drink too much coffee when..." jokes: You ski uphill You answer the door before people knock You just completed another sweater and you don't know how to knit Your T-shirt says, "Decaffeinated coffee is the devil's coffee"

Coffee Anonymous I hate to admit it. I think I'm an addict. I need coffee! What I don't get is that I am completely fine on the weekend and can go without. During the week... my motivation for coming to work is knowing that there will be hot(and free) cup of coffee. I used to look down upon the coffee addicts and now I have become one. Whyyyy? If that wasn't bad enough... when this habit started they used to have a good sized styrofoam cup. Now.. they made the cups smaller. Of course I could get two cups but I somehow felt cheated. UGHHH! Pretty soon I know I will have brown ugly teeth. I should just start investing in whitening strips now. I think I will do an experiment. I will try to pass on coffee tomorrow to see if I notice a change. I would do it today but I already had my cup of brain juice for the day... (and it was good).

Typical Monday Monday night is the typical school night. Much to my surprise time in class last night went by much quicker. The topics were somewhat interesting. We reviewed different types of torts in law. I can't recall any of them right now... negligence, intentional torts, something like that.

Going Back to Cali... again Saturday and Sunday consisted of long stays at the hospital. Much to my surprise the hospital cafeteria had great minestrone. We ate there a couple of times. Saturday night we played poker and spades. I won both times... woowoo! Sunday we went to the hospital again. Sue (Charles' grandma that's in the hospital) was sitting up when I went in to see her. I felt kind of akward going in to see her. I didn't want to see her alone so I went with Charles' Aunt Peggy. When I went into her room she was sitting up in a chair. Also she had tubes coming out of everywhere. If someone were to pick her up by all the tubes she would look like a marionette. There was food on the tray in front of her and the only thing that I feard was that Aunt Peggy would ask if I could feed her. Then something else that made me feel kind of funny was the fact that she had to put her teeth in. At this point I don't think I could have stayed in the room much longer. So I helped out with the feeding by asking what she wanted to eat. After about 10-15 minutes I told her bye and told Aunt Peggy that I was going out so someone else could come in. Then Charles' grandma said, "Thank you so much for coming".

Going Back to Cali.. Last nights flight was fine. My mom dropped me off at the airport early and I was in the coveted 'A' group. This means I got to board the plan ahead of about 150 others. I was about 10th in line and when I sat down I thought for sure I would have an empty space next to me but some lady sat by me. She passed my 'good flight neighbor' test: 1)Wasn't obese so she was touching me when she really didn't mean to; 2) Didn't smell; 3) Only spoke when spoken to. Getting to Charles' parents house was easy enough. I got there, the fed me and we watched Last Samurai, then went to bed.

Bag Lady I was up late last night doing a load of wash and packing for the short trip. I am amazed at my packing skills. I used the smallest luggage for my clothes which includes 3 outfits for 2 days. My mom taught me to always pack one more then what was really needed... "you can never be safe". I fly out tonight and then I will be back on Sunday. I expect the weekend to be uneventful, which isn't totally that bad. I know we will spend some time in the hospital so I made sure to pack a book. I probably would have packed myself soem crayons and a coloring book but decided not to because I may be forced to share.

The big 6-0!!! Today is my dad's birthday. He is the big 6-0 today. I got him a present and a card but I didn't get to see him on his birthday because he worked late. I hate it when they send him to Nogales at 5pm because it means he will not be back until after 9pm. UGH! I told my mom that we would have to get together to celebrate his b-day and Mother's Day since I will be out of town and my dad also has to work on Mother's day. Maybe a nice dinner. We shall see.

Finally I bought my tickets to go to LA today. In other news I bought my mom and sister their Mother's Day Cards yesterday. I was among the throng who were purchasing cards. I couldn't believe all the people in the card section at Target. After selecting 3 cards: birthday card for my dad and 2 for Mom's day. It was kind of nice browsing the store without Charles. YES I MISS HIM!!! But I have to admit, it was nice being able to look around without the sigh of boredom from him or the feeling of being rushed. While I was looking at the baby clothes for the I-Man, I saw Too Tall checking out. I considered yelling "Cracker your beans are over here!!!!" but decided not to. Plus, I don't think I can yell that loud.

Sunday is the day that Charles will be back. As I said in my previous post Charles wants me to go out there to be with him and his family while his Grandma is in the hospital. I still have to buy my tickets. It is such a short trip that is about $200. Eeek.

Shot out to my group Charles wants me to go to California this weekend to be with his family. I'm sure he misses me too. That has to be it. I have a major group assignment due on Monday. My group (of only one other person) said she wouldn't mind taking care of the assignment. That was really nice of her. She rocks! For now that is...

Walk, Eat, Walk Went to eat with Molly at Gavi. We walked from her apartment to the restaurant. I had stuffed eggplant which was excellent. Molly had cheese whatchamacallit. I think it was tortellini. Talked about this and that. Mostly about that. Walked back to her place and she gave me a sourvenir Minnie Mouse doll from her Disneyland trip. Minnie Mouse has 6 points of articulation. Minnie will be my new desk mate.

Sick as a Dog I don't know what it was last night in class but I felt so sick. My head was pounding and I felt like I was going to puke. It didn't help that last night was the first night of Business Law and she kept us there until 10. Eeeek!!

Hasta Luego My parents accompanied me to the airport in Phoenix yesterday to drop off Charles. Why Phoenix and not Tucson you ask? Nothing was available yesterday from Tucson to LAX, but there were some from Phoenix to Ontario which is closer to the hospital Charles' grandma is in. So we dropped him off at the Phoenix airport with an In and Out burger and he was set. My parents and I went shopping at JCPenney outlet. Picked up some socks for $.99 for Charles and picked up four big plastic pots for outside. Spent less than $25, Charles would be proud. Afterwards we went to Cracker Barrel for dinner then drove home.

Rough weekend Friday night was the last time I saw Denise and Isaac before they left today. I didn't think it would impact me so much. I hard such a hard time sleeping. I was crying so much I had to get up because I didn't want to wake up Charles. He slept like a log. Saturday we cleaned house. I had about 7 loads of laundry that I had to wash. I didn't even realize Charles and I had enough clothes that would make 7 loads. Charles got up early to make his toy rounds. I got up early thinking that I would join him. He was supposed to go to Target and then come home and pick me up to go to a toy show. Of course after I showered at 730am, I decided not to go so I called him and told him to just head straight to the toy show. While I was getting ready, Jan (Charles' mom) called. She wanted to let us know that her mom had a heart attack and was in ICU. She was stable but they were going to run tests on her. I immediately called Charles. He came home and called his mom. We bought a airline ticket for Charles to go. He will be there today and comeback on Wednesday.

Yes it's true. I was among the first to see urlLink Spiderman 2 . It was actually a last minute decision. A coworker of mine said she was going to see the movie at midnight and asked if I'd like to go. I talked to the husband and he said fine. I got out of class last night at about 9:55... UGH! I went home and picked up Charles and we headed over to the theater. When we got there I expected a long line, but to my surprise there was no line at all. We headed right in and saw the reason why. There were people seated already... but it wasn't too packed at 10:45. Enough about that... let me tell you about the movie: The special effects were good. They would be great but there were some digimations (is that a word?) that were cheesy. Yes I know it is a comic book but they weren't as clear and looked more cartoonish. The music was great! There were three prevalent plots: 1)Good vs. Evil - Of course there was the evil guy Dr. Octopus. Without giving away the ending... I had trouble with the way the struggle came out. My thoughts were "he could have done that at any time he wanted?" Once you see the movie you will know what I'm talking about. 2)Identity - Peter Parker (aka Spiderman) has trouble with the dual life i.e. hero vs. average joe. Of course we know how that ends up. Go Spidey go! 3)Relationships - This was the one I was most interested in. There was the Harry (Green Goblin's son) turmoil with Spiderman. Harry basically wants to avenge his father's death. There was also the relationship with Mary Jane... yay! (I am saying no more about that one). I loved the movie and in no way was I disappointed. The ending definately left me wanting more.

First of all I'm sorry I haven't been posting. So to all my reader (yes I know it's not plural) I apologize. "You're gonna stand there, owning a fireworks stand, and tell me you don't have no whistling bungholes, no spleen spliters, whisker biscuits, honkey lighters, hoosker doos, hoosker donts, cherry bombs, nipsy daisers, with or without the scooter stick, or one single whistling kitty chaser?" -- Joe Dirt to a fireworks salesman The familia should be back from Montana today. Yay! My nephew called me on Sunday to make sure he bought me some Black Cats. They are bringing back some fireworks and I'm so excited. Now where to set them off is onther thing... I'm sure I'll have fun with that.

Just got an update from the folks in Montana. Apparently Asia and Jesus (Abram's friend) were at the river behind my sister's home. Jesus was swimming and Asia caught a turtle. She caught a freakin' turtle? She is so adventurous and nothing like my handsome boy Abram. Abram was so clean as a kid. I remember once when he fell in the water in the garden section of KMart. He was totally grossed out and started gagging. I think he puked on himself too because he was so grossed out. Asia was the one that liked to play in the mud and get dirty. She's my midget woman... my turtle catching midget woman.

Class was so painful yesterday. There was this guy there who had a big mouth. Would not shut his piehole! Anytime he spoke, eyes rolled and loud sighs followed. I'm just glad there were others who felt the same.

I was chatting with a friend about possible baby names for when Charles and I have our own midget and the conversation went something like this: Me: Caleb A friend: bleh too trendy Me: Ethan A friend: That's nice Nathan "Nate" Me: I'm giving our child his slave name A friend: rofl TOBY! A friend: Toby Kunta Kinte Milton bradley Lamar Burton Madero Perez Me: YES! I'm writing that one down Later it gets better... let's just say that many of the names started with Ivana and followed up by middle names that would cross my PG rating.

Yes it is true... I'm back on the coffee. It is awful because I'm not used to the cafeine and when I drink it I can't concentrate. But I need it to help keep me awake, but what good am I if I can't concentrate? Damn this cup of brain juice! Damn you Juan Valdez! Okay I don't really mean it because I'm sure I will be snuggling up to my cup tomorrow morning.

I had that line from Nell stuck in my head yesterday: 'Twee in da win, chickapee, ma and pa and mae'. I just kept saying it over and over. Last night Charles and I watched a foreign film called urlLink Musa . It was okay. I only agreed to watch it because I wanted to play Dynasty Warriors 3 afterwards. After I got my fill of DW3, I finished my school work. I'm taking Buyer Behavior now and it should be a breeze. I will keep my fingers crossed.

I forgot to mention something that happened while we were eating at Claim Jumper's. While we were eating I just started wondering about the waiters and waitresses. I wondered if they ever got sick of watching people eat. So I made the comment to Charles and about a minute later he stopped eating. He looked at me and asked me why I even brought it up because now he couldn't eat his food. He said that he looked around and the people eating grossed him out. Truth be told, I too was getting grossed out by looking at people eat and I had to stop. The food that I did have was great though. You know the whole 'think before you speak' doesn't really stick in my head. I guess at times I have no inner monologue.

After the game Friday, Charles and I stayed the night in Phoenix. Saturday he got up early and got ready to go to KMart. He had to look up a location of a KMart and off he went. They were having some sort of Hot Wheels event. He called me afterwards and said he got some cars that he needed for his collection. Yay! After that he came and we checked out of the room and went to eat at Claim Jumper. Love there food. We walked around the mall and then headed home.

Friday night was my introductory game to the WNBA. The whole experience was awesome! We got there about 6:45pm and the game started at 7. We were watching the gals warmup. Diana Taurasi is the one with the bun (in the middle) The Mercs played the L.A. Sparks. Lisa Leslie (center for the Sparks) is such a unique player. She seems like she is bored of playing and not putting forth any effort. She scored 17 points, had 2 assists and 1 blocked shot. The Sparks could have fed it into her all night long. The awesome player was of course Ms. Diana Taurasi. I have to admit she was cold the first 8-10 minutes but she just was on fire after. She typically averages 17 points per game but last night she had 25 points and 3 assists. Some of the shots she made reminded me so much of Magic. I'm so happy I got to see her play and it seems that she is quit the crowd favorite. The crowd went wild anytime she scored and also if her name was mentioned. The Sparks did seem like they were going to have an easy win becaus at one point they led by as much as 23 points. The Mercs made a few runs and by the end of the game the score was 76-74... Sparks. Well shucks! View from our seats. The player there is Lisa Leslie. Ooooh... Kimberly Locke was there and sang the National Anthem... WOW! She has a set of pipes.She also sang during halftime. One more thing about the whole Mercury experience. I didn't quite catch it at first. It took me about 15 minutes into the game. There were plenty of bi-level haircuts and mullets on the ladies. There was this one lad... I mean lady that kept yelling during the game. It appeared that Lisa Leslie is not a favorite in Phoenix. She seemed to be a ref fav according to the lady. Some of her jeering follows: "What happened Lisa did you break a nail?" "Oh don't be to rough with Lisa!" right after the foul she said "Lisa don't your elbows ever get sore?!" (personal fav)

I am wearing my new Hufflepuff shirt today. For the muggles it is one of four houses in Hogwarts... ya know from Harry Potter? So I go and get some water this morning and someone goes to me are you sure that you should be wearing that shirt to work? I was totally thinking it was a joke but after about 5 seconds of silence I took it that this person was serious. I asked why they felt it was inappropriate. "You know HUFF and PUFF?" I politely smiled and said that it was not a reference to anytype of recreational drug use but to a house in Hogwarts from Harry Potter. They looked at me and said 'right'. I have never seen this person before in my life. I'm sure they work here because they have a badge but they were new to me. What nerve!

Called Abram last night and he told me he's been taking pics with his phone. Wednesday night they stayed in Utah and last night they arrived in Montana. He took a couple of pics and I thought I would share them... North Rim of the Grand Canyon Jesus, Dad, Asia and Mom breakin' the fast

Charles called me at work yesterday telling me that it was the worst day of his life. He said that he had to call 911 twice in one day. He's in charge of a summer program that has about 80 kids. He went on to explain that there was a runaway and another occurence. I told him instead of making his day worse by cooking for him, that I will take him out to eat. So we had Chinese food and rented a couple of DVDs. We watched urlLink 50 First Dates and I thought it was cute. I love practically anything with Drew Barrymore. Adam Sandler's movies are pretty good except urlLink Little Nicky that was 90 minutes that I will never get back from my life. The other movie we rented was urlLink Paycheck . I haven't watched it yet and have this feeling of disappointment settling in my stomach since Ben Affleck is in it. I hope to be presently surprised.

I had a meeting at work yesterday from 4-5 that was really from 4-5:30. GROSS! Last night after I got home I had to endure urlLink My Baby's Daddy ... yuck. I think I smirked at one or two parts of the movie.

I got an A in Business Law. Yay! I realize now that I have four classes left. That means 19 more weeks of school. Hey that is really 18 weeks of school because I will be missing the 4th week of my new class, Buyer Behavior. Speaking of my new class my instructor reminds me so much of Chris Kattan. You know the little guy that was on SNL? He brought the characters of Mango, Roxbury guys, Mr. Peepers, Azrael (goth guy), Gay Hitler, plus a dozen more to life. "Maaaaaaannngo!" I think this one should be interesting.

I'm in such a funk over the work occurences for the past few days. But what can ya do? So I decided to stop getting all worked up about the whole situation and move on. Not moving on from the company but moving on in the sense that I'm putting this issue back in the drawer and will open it up another time.

Not that I get any readers BUT in case I do... I didn't realize that I could change the setting of who is allowed to make comments on my posts. So now anyone and everyone can make comments on any entry their heart desires. So come one, come all (ok more like one) and leave a comment if you wish to do so.

In high school I was the first one to drive out of all my friends. So naturally I was the taxi when we went out except for one night. On a Saturday night, I picked up A, J and M to go to a quincenera party at some dance hall. Well I was lucky enough to pick up a variety of liquor and we drank it on the way. Ugh.. I remember it was St. Ides too (the red and blue ones). So we drank it and then went to the dance hall and headed inside. We met several of our friends there and continued to drink in the parking lot. Well all good things must come to an end... BUT I couldn't drive. I was completely gone (yes now I realize it was really stupid but I was in high school cut me some slack). So my friend J, who just got her driver's permit earlier that week, had to drop M and A. A and I were fighting for some reason I can't recall. After droping them off, she had to get home. Of course I was in no condition to drive but she drove me to my house. We got down and she waited in the living room. I stumbled to my parents room and knocked on the door and told my dad that he would have to take J home. He asked me why and I told him I 'felt funny'. He asked why and I told him someone must have spiked my drink. My dad was furious and the best part that it wasn't at me! He put on his coat and took J home and took me straight to the TMC emergency room. I escaped being grounded but I paid for it the next day while I was praying to the almighty porcelain god to make the pounding in my head stop.

Went over to my parents house tonight to bid them a fond farewell. They are off to see the big chuck in Montana. My dad, mom, Abram, Asia and Jesus (Abram's friend) are all leaving to Montana. They are going to be gone for two and a half weeks! My handsome boy and midget woman are not going to be here. That also means that my dad isn't going to be here for Father's Day :( I will just have to make sure that I give my mom my pop's card. Oooh I also have to get a card for Chris (Denise's husband) because this is his first Father's Day with I-Man.

Friday Charles and I went to go eat at Wing Stop. Had me some goodola chicken wings. Afterwards we went to Target and I cut myself on a shopping cart. How you ask? I have no clue. I was just walking along the aisles getting the necessities and I look down and and noticed a red stuff on the cart (not the red handle BTW). I look at my arm and there was blood everywhere. So I went to the bathroom cleaned off and had the cart cleaned and continued my shopping adventure. Saturday Charles and I met my mom, Dina and the kids for lunch. Afterwards we went to the movies and saw urlLink Shrek 2 . I loved it. I especially liked the Antonio Banderas' character Puss In Boots. Afterwards, we went home and went swimming. Later we watched urlLink Mystic River . Bleh... it was just okay. I expected more. I'm not a big Sean Penn fan but he did do a great job in this movie. Other than that... bleh. Sunday Didn't do a darn thing all day. I invited my family over but they were busy getting ready for the Montana trip. It was a great day to just unwind and take a dip. That is exactly what we did. Oh I did buy my ticket to go to Montana in July. It was $350. eeek. I'm sorry I waited so long to buy it. Charles isn't going to come with me to Montana, instead he is going out to visit the folks in L.A. We bought his ticket there and I have to drop him off at the bahoozie early hour of 5am July 2nd. He sure is lucky I love him. =)

Awhile ago Molly told me about the In2Books Pen Pal Program. I filled out the form last October and got as far as submitting a introductory letter and a visual profile. I never heard back from them... until now! I guess they waited for the new school year and asked me to do everything over again, so I did. Maybe this time I will actually have some pen pals.

Last night Charles went swimming and I sat on the edge of the pool. The pool is the perfect temperature. I didn't want to go swimming because I would have to dry my hair before bed... yes I was being lazy. Sitting by the pool with Bo on my lap was nice. After about 40 minutes, I went inside and played urlLink Army Men:RTS . It is the typical Command and Conquer strategy game. I just love it because the army men are the green plastic toys. Of course I looked up some codes for extra plastic because that is the material needed for buildings, cars, and soldiers. It just reminded me of the good ole Contra code for Nintendo. The code that gave you infinite lives. I can't believe I still remember that code. UP, DOWN, UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, LEFT, RIGHT, A, B, A, B, Select, Start. Yet another piece of useless information. I'm sure there is a lot more where that came from.

I went to see it Friday night with Charles, Asia, a co-worker and her boyfriend. We got there about five for the seven showing and there were still 15 people in front of us. I didn't mind waiting, before we went to see the movie Charles bought me a box of PoA trading cards by urlLink Artbox . Apparently in order to get the costume cards, prop cards or autographs you need to buy the hobby box which is about $100 more. It was fun opening the card packs though. Back to the movie though... it was great. It was better than the first two and much darker. I just find it amazing that the movie is exactly the way I imagined it when I read book 3 from the Dementors to Trelawney to the Maurader's map to Buckbeak. I plan on reading the book again this week and then go watch the movie again. My favorite character is Hermione. She has some great moments in the movie. I absolutely love the part where she punches Draco in the nose. Oh and her line of "is that really what my hair looks like from behind?" was great! I can't wait for urlLink Goblet of Fire . It is supposed to be released in November 2005. The count down begins.

Sunday June 6th is my parent's 40th wedding anniversary. My Dad decided to surprise my mom and renew their wedding vows. It was great watching them renew their vows. My Dad got teary eyed and my Mom cried. Here they are gettin' hitched again... Afterwards we went to church and then to Coco's for a salad then about 3 hours later we went Olive Garden. There were about 25 people in our party. We had to wait about an hour and a half but the time flew by because we were all having a good time. I had the seafood alfredo and a beer, which isn't a good combo but I just felt like having a beer. Charles had stuffed ravioli... bleh it was aight. I like Caruso's much better.

Molly: I just told a guy in IM that I thought his nipples were huge. Me: I remember in middle school this guy had the longest nipples I have ever seen Me: You could hang a coat on those suckers! Molly: hahahaah LONG nipples? that's gross I am dying and I want to puke all at the same time

Saw the movie urlLink Monster last night. It was pretty good. Charlize Theron looked so different in this role as Molly said, "she was chunkie monkey". I found the following pics of her and the real Wournos.

After work yesterday I went to the pizza joint and looked for the waitress. I asked the girl that was there and she said that the person I talked to left for the day. Talked to the Manager and found out that he couldn't do anything either. So I left my contact information and headed home. I got home changed and went to the gym then came home. I called the bank and they said they usually allot more funds for restaurant transactions because they never know if they leave a tip. I thougth it was wrong but oh well. After that I figured it was my bank. Charles and I started watching the movie Monster. Then I get a call from the owner of the pizza joint. He called an confirmed how much I was charged. So all is well. I may have over reacted a bit but oh well.

Yesterday Dina, the kids, my mom and I went to a great pizza place by the UofA. So I paid for the dinner which was yummy. Plus it was only $37.61. I gave my card to my nephew, he went to the counter, signed the bill and then gave me my copy. My sis left a $6 tip. When I got home later, I gave Charles his pizza surprise. He loves the pizza from this place. Later Charles is doing the checkbook and asked me what I spent $45.61 on. I told him the only place I used my debit card was the pizza joint. So after looking at the receipt and looking at the $45.61 online, I finally put the 2 and 2 together. They added 20% onto my bill. I couldn't believe it. So I called the pizza place and told them that I ate there yesterday. Receipt says X my online statement says Y. I told them I wouldn't really make a big deal out of $7 but I left a cash tip and I like there food there but I don't think I could eat there again if this happened. So lady on the phone said she would look for the receipt and I will meet up there later so we can talk about what happened. We shall see...

Just wanted to make note a few of the things that make me happy. I was in the bathroom today and noticed how in one of the stalls they only have rolled toilet paper. In every other stall there is the tissue type of paper. I much prefer the tissue type dispensed paper. If toilet paper is rolled then it must... I repeat MUST BE PERFORATED. I hate it when it isn't. The other item is a toilet seat cover that already has a cut and I don't have to tear the perforation. I know big deal about nothing, but then again is there anything that I discuss that is a big deal?

I was just talking to a friend at work here and she said you remind me so much of my cousin. I said really? What about me reminds you? And my friend said the way I look. So I said you got a picture? So she shows me a picture and the girl was ugly!!! I couldn't recover. I looked at my watch and said I had a meeting. I wanted to scream at her and say... WHAT THE HECK IS WRONG WITH YOU?!!

Friday... Went to the movies to see Day After Tomorrow. It was okay. Saturday... Went to Nogales and picked up some Mexican Candy and some pastries. Charles and I went with Dina, my Mom, Abram, Asia and two other cousins (Linda and Ericka). Sunday... We went to my cousin's house in the desert. It has to be one of the nicest homes in Tucson that I have ever seen. I'm sure it was about 3500 sq feet. It was just amazing. The view was spectacular. My cousin said it took two years to build the home. It gave Charles and me an idea that we need to buy land now so we can build a home later. I doubt that will happen. Monday... I invited my Mom, Dina and the kids to come over to go swiming. Charles and I made Won Tons and shrimp with rice. It was deelish!

I can't believe I'm up this early on a weekend. What gives? I couldn't sleep anymore... hrmf. Yesterday I talked to the hiring manager for the position that posted. It went great. I felt really comfortable talking to her and bythe end of it it seemed like we were just finishing each other's sentences. She is looking for someone to start in mid August. It looks promising. In other news... Team member 'T' for school has been diligently working on the paper and I asked for team member 'C' to do week 4. She politely says, "sorry thought you knew. I dropped the class". Huh? 1) No I didn't know. 2) Thanks for the communication. Now each team in our class has 4 or more members except for us. We had three and now we are down to two. It's okay since the team member 'C' didn't input much into the first paper anyway.

Yesterday was such a great day. First- I got all the turmoil from work resolved. I feel great about it because it was physically making me sick. I'm glad it is all behind me now. Second- Got my tuition reimbursement check. Money, money, money, money, MONEY! Third- A new position at work that was rumored to open that I am reeealllly interested in finally posted. Keep ya informed on that one. Fourth- After much deliberation, Charles and I went to the bank transferred some money and paid off my car. I still had about another 14 months to go... not no mo. Yay! After we paid off my car we had a celebratory dinner at some Chinese food place. I was eating some General Tso's chicken. I was sure that I picked out all of the chili, but NOOOO! I ate one and it was the one of the worst things ever. My eyes started watering. My tongue was on fire. No amount of water, soda, pudding, ice or tongue scrapping helped. About 20 minutes later everything was okay but by that time, I couldn't even eat anything. Luckily the General Tso's chicken was the last thing left on my plate.

Skipped the gym last night. Charles took me to go get some sushi. It was fabulous. We typically go to Bunbuku on Broadway. There was awhile there where we would go every Friday. Of course we get the same thing each time. It has been about 2 months since we last went but when we walked in she asked us if we wanted the same thing... she got a nice tip. Afterwards we went to Target and Toys R Us and came out empty handed.

Email correspondence with the big chuck (Denise) Denise: Do you have the song Fantastic Voyage by Lakeside (Coolio did a remake of it)? Me: I can get it. When do you need it by? Denise: When you can. no big rush. People here at work didn't know it was a remake. Me: WHAT?!! Blasphemy! Chuck you can not work under these conditions. What kind of savages are you working with? I suggest you quietly pack your bags. Tip-toe with your back facing the door and once you reach it, run like you have never ran before to your car and NEVER look back.

Last night went to school. I think I have the ignoratory voice. (I'm not sure if that is even a word. Can you change the word ignore into an adjective? Oh well I like making up words.) So we get into a group exercise. Instructor lady had us count off by fours. Got in our group and discussed the exercise. I was talking to them and giving my input. I could have sworn they were listening cause I got the eye contact and a confirmation head nods. About 2 seconds after I finished my input, another girl talks and says practically verbatim what I said. The reaction from the other members acted as if it were the first time ever they heard it... "That's a great idea", "Oh yeah I never considered that", "That's important because...". Bleh... oh well. I must have that type of voice that has the right combination of pitch, decibal, tone and some other characteristic that gets lost easily. I could never be a radio host. After school, Charles did a short toy run to Wal-Mart and Big-K. I can easily see this turning into a routine after school.

Yesterday after work I went home. Picked up Sugar and took her back to my parent's home. It was nice to the family. It was the first time I saw them since they were on vacation. They got me some nice Dopey merchandise. I got a Dopey link for my Italian Charm bracelet and a Dopey charm for my charm bracelet. I picked up some Eegee's later on, watched some tv and then headed home. Hmmm... let me see. I also did some homework last night. Piece of cake. My group isn't as involved as I'd hoped. I sent them the paper on Sunday and did not hear back from them at all. I finally had to call them late last night and ask if the paper was okay... "yeah it's fine." Okay thank you for keeping the open lines of communication. What I'm happy about is that I don't have to do another group paper. Now it is their turn... mwah ah ah ah. Who am I kidding? I know I am going to contribute. Damn this conscience of mine!!!

Friday night Charles and I stayed home. Nothing new on the home front. Saturday we went to my parent's house to water her jungle. That took about 90 minutes and then we were off to Phoenix to see Mercury play the Indiana Fever. Woo Woo! The game was great. They actually won! The score was 56 - 71. Ms. Hoffman didn't get playing time till second half. Plus D Taurasi was injured the first half so she did not play in the second half. Hrmf. I know she's off to play in the olympics and I must admit, I was really close to buying her USA jersey, but then it hit me. When will I wear this? I would probably buy it and have her autograph it... naawww doubt it. Here are some pics to document the road trip: urlLink Here are the ladies of Phoenix Mercury warming up before the big game. urlLink urlLink Here is Ebony (Big Dog) Hoffman # 34 running into position. urlLink Oh and in case you're wodnering (which I doubt ya are) I didn't do a darn thing on Sunday and that was alright with me.

After rescuing Sugar, her and I went back to my home. Charles made his fantastic world famous teriyaki chicken. Yummy. He popped in a movie he rented called urlLink The Big Bounce . Yawn... I couldn't finish watching it. So went to the computer room and did some school stuff. Charles said he was going to take the movie back and I hear the front door slam. Then I hear it open about 5 minutes later. He said my car is dead. WHAT?! My car was packed behind his, so we had to put my car in neutral and let it roll back so Charles had enough room to pull his car out. Gave my car a jump to get it going. Got it over to Auto Zone and mechanic, oil drenched, beer gut, guy says that my battery is dead... DUH! Thanks Earl. Charles changed the battery and we were on our way back home.

Today after work I went to my parents' home. As I walk in I realize that they left the AC off... how dare they! I also look around and see that they set off some bug bombs. So it is hot as heck and I realize there was no air circulating since they have been gone. When I look on one of the counters, there I see Geico's cage. I already knew what to expect. When I got closer my assumption was verified. There belly up in his cage was Geico. Poor little guy. My emotions got the best of me and I called my parents and told them they poisoned a harmless, innocent creature. They were still in Disneyland and I don't think they heard me... hrmf. After the 2 hour watering marathon, I was able to leave. Since I didn't want Sugar (the family chihuahua) to meet her maker prematurely like good ole Geico, I brought her home with me. Moment of silence for the sweet sweet Geico please.

Thursday... only 1 more day left. Yesterday the familia left for California. The folks and Dina and the kids all left yesterday about 3pm. One member that did stay behind was Sugar. My Dad wants her to stay at their house and Iâ€™m supposed to go to their home everyday to pick up the mail, water the plants and feed Sugar. They will be back on Sunday so it will only be four days. Oh and I was given the task to set free Asiaâ€™s gecko, who she named Geico. This Saturday is yet another exciting Phoenix Mercury game. I liked the last urlLink Mercury game I attended. This time they are supposed to be playing Indiana Fever. urlLink Ebony Hoffman , a.k.a. Big Dog, plays for Indiana Fever. She used to play for Narbonne High School in Harbor City, CA then later went to USC. According to Charles, she is really, really, really good. I would think since she did go 9th in the WNBA draft, that she was/is a good player. Iâ€™m sure I get to see her skills on Saturday.

Last night's Sales Management class was decent. I had a headache but overall it was a okay. There's a student in class that has a French accent. I could probably listen to her talk all night long. She could have been reading the ingredients to toothpaste and I probably could have found it beautiful. I was tempted to ask her to say 'solid' like Claude (Hank Azaria) in urlLink Along Came Polly . Oh and the big mouth guy is still in class. Practically after every sentence the teacher said, he would comment. Each time after he spoke there were synchronized sighs. Charles' class went well. He was so nervous heading in and afterwards he was excited. Awww I wish I still had that enthusiasm for school. With this week completed, I only have 14 more weeks and the enthusiasm has been long gone well before this class.

On my MP3 player I have a playist that has many slow pop songs. I did this before I went to Montana in hopes that when I played it, I would fall asleep. It worked!! I also found that it works a little too well. I was listening to it at work and found my eyes closing. Here are the songs that are on this playlist: Mandy Moore - "Only Hope" Mandy Moore - "Cry" Nsync - "Gone" Jojo - "Leave (Get Out)" Justin Timberlake - "Never Again" Mya - "If You Were Mine" Mariah Carey - "Fourth of July" Mariah Carey - "Melt Away" Mariah Carey - "Underneath The Stars" Mariah Carey - "When I Saw You" So if you need some help sleeping try listening to these to zzzzzzzzzzz.

Well another class begins. Joy. I am seriously getting burned out and find that my attention is dwindling. Charles is starting class tonight also. He was asking me all these questions about protocol. Awww he's so cute when he's nervous. He had me read his paper about 4 times to make sure it was okay. I should have directed him to this blog to show him examples of what not to do. Walking into work today, I noticed all these leaves on the ground. As I got closer they started jumping. Then I realized those aren't leaves at all but they were grasshoppers... or grasshoppa. It was disgusting because it was like a blanket of grasshoppers and each step I took more and more jumped. Good thing I wore pants instead of shorts today.

Just saw a friend from work in the hall, worst coffee death breath in the world. I think he bleached my hair. In other news... Charles starts his first class tomorrow. I think it is Introduction to Human Services. That will be nice. I'm just hoping that we get out about the same time since I also have class tomorrow and we will be driving there together.

Friday Went over to the parental unit's casa. Played Mexican Train with Double 15s. The game took about 3 and a half hours to complete. By the end of it I was crowned the Queen of the Train... woowoo I won! Saturday I played Dynasty Warriors 3 for the longest time and then got ready. Charles and I went to Costco and Target. Bought urlLink Digital Fortress by Dan Brown. I'm still reading urlLink The Dante Club and find it hard to hold my attention. I'm going to stick to it though. Sunday I volunteered to help out with the audio visual team at church and I was supposed to 'shadow' someone so I could be shown the ropes. When I went to the observation room, high above the church, I was told the projector died. It was about time. The beast was about 16 years old. The church will be purchasing a new one this week. It will be nice to have some new technology. After church, the parents, Dina and the kids, Charles and I went to go eat. I came home and played some more DW3. Asia was later dropped off so she could go to work with Charles today. I think this is his last week of the summer program... so he said that he would take Asia so she could play with some of the kids. Awww how sweet.
I got an A in my last class which was Buyer Behavior. I am now going to start Sales Management. Only three more classes or 15 weeks or 60 hours... not that I'm counting.

or maybe not. I forgot to mention that while I was in Montana I read urlLink Deception Point by Dan Brown. I really enjoy his style of writing and the three novels, urlLink Angels & Demons , urlLink The Da Vinci Code and urlLink Deception Point , have all been page-turners. Charles and I went to the Scion dealership yesterday and we ordered ourselves a Scion xB model. It will be nice to get a new car. I know a lot of people don't like it but I think it is unique. Take a looksie...

I got up early to get ready to take Denise to work. After dropping her off, I went to due some toy rounds but came out empty handed. Oh well. I went back to the house so I could finish laundry and packing. Then about 2ish I picked up midget man from daycare. It was so beautiful spending some time with him and realized next time I see him he will be crawling. I can't wait to see what type of trouble he gets into. With my bags all packed and Isaac securely fastened in his seat, I picked up Denise from work at 3:30. She stayed with me in the airport for awhile and about 15 minutes before the plane boarded I passed security. While waiting to board I was listening to the soothing sounds of No Doubt's "Don't Speak" except it was done in elevator music format. When I arrived in Billings, MT, I noticed they had the same type of music playing. This time it was "Rapper's Delight"... I wish I would have recorded some. It would have been hysterical. Billings to Las Vegas was fine. Las Vegas to Tucson was okay except that we boarded about 90 minutes later than we were supposed to. Charles I'm sure is hating life today because he got about 3-4 hours of sleep to last him throughout the day.

Sunday we went on a float. The water must have been in the 60s brrrr. Denise and I went and battled a bit o' white water. Okay not much because we were on inner tubes but we got splashed quite a few times. I saw a water snake and it fer-eeeked me out. I panicked because I'm deathly afraid of snakes. I think the rest of the way I kept my butt out of the water. After the float we picked up some grub and went back to the house. It was a nice way to end my Montana trip.

Well it is true... I accomplished one of my goals in life. I have a favorite arcade game called Star Wars Trilogy. One of my goals was to score high enough to actually input my initials into the freaking game. Yesterday when I went to the mall in beautiful Missoula, I went to the CyberArcade. Imagine my surprise when I saw they had my game and my complete excitement when I saw it was only 2 tokens to play... yay! When all was said and done the game ended and I was getting ready to get up and tada... it had the infamous prompt for initials. Before I go back to Tucson I have to try playing the game again because I am not going to settle for 49th place (out of 50). After entering my initials I knew the day was going to be great.
I just made dinner for Chris and Denise. Yummy Spam and cabbage, rice and sauteed mushrooms. Tomorrow I think I will make Chicken Nuggets... that should be really yummy and NO it won't be from McD's.

Yesterday Denise, Isaac and I went to the mall. I spotted out some stuff that I want to buy and with no sales tax I'm all over it. In the evening, Denise and I went to Sean Kelly's for dinner and we met some of her friends. Every Tuesday night they have quiz night. There are several teams that compete for what I'm not sure... I guess just bragging rights. It was a lot of fun. I laughed, I cried, I drank a couple of Fat Tires and I was set. It was great meeting some of Denise's friends. They are great people.

Last night I went to work with Denise. We showed up about 9pm. While she worked, I wrote my paper for class. The time went by quick and at about 1245am, Denise ashed me if I wanted to see the press. It was amazing. We walk down a couple flights of stairs and she opens two double metal doors. There were hundreds of stacks of spooled paper. If one were to fall it would smask anything in its path. As we walk through this maze of spooled paper I hear some type of loud rumbling and it got louder and louder. Finally I saw the press. It was amazing. It was printing the day's edition of the paper. This machine was just massive in everyway. I had seen it before on a trip, but never got to see it in action.

Sunday was the big day... Flying from Tucson to Phoenix was fine. Flying from Phoenix to Boise was fine. When I landed in Boise I had to switch airlines since the carrier I was flying didn't fly directly to Missoula. No big deal. I went to the carrier and checked in and then got my board pass. As we got the boarding call I looked out the window and only saw a small plane with two propellers and thatâ€™s it. I thought surely we are walking to one of the bigger planesâ€¦ nope. That plane was ours. So I walk from the boarding gate down to the prop plane. After being greeted by the co-pilot and I climbed up into the plane and my heart immediately started to race. There were only two single rows of seats. Iâ€™m awful at writing descriptions but imagine a metal lawn chair bolted down to some wood and to make sure it looks somewhat presentable it is covered by some dirty berber carpet. That was the main cabin of this plane. After climbing finding my lawn chairâ€¦ I mean seat, the main cabin door was closed. Once the propellers started the whole plane started to vibrate. I thought for sure that I would be digginâ€™ my fingers into the seat in front of me but once we got in the air, I was out. I think the combination of the vibration from the propellers and the comfort of the chair put me to sleep. Before I knew the 70 minute flight went by and I was in Missoula.

Saturday we went to go eat dinner for my grandfather's 80th birthday. It was nice to see him and my grandma. Afterwards I went to pick up the dogs, and drop them off at my parents house. They are going to watch Bo and Pixie for me until Charles gets back on Tuesday. After I dropped the dogs at their grandma's house, I went home to pack. I got home about 7:30, did a couple of loads of laundry, washed the dishes, mopped the floor, folded the clothes and then started packing... packing... packing. I was packing my suitcase and vanity case and then I just happened to get up and look at the clock and it said 12:30am... eeek! I had to get up at 4am so my dad could take me to the airport. I quickly finished packing and then went to bed.

Ahhhhh. The extended night's rest was much appreciated. I must have been running on fumes for that past few days. It was not fun at all. Prior to going to bed Charles called me up to let me know he was going to see some hip-hop orchestra (I didn't know it was possible either). I asked him to call me when he gets home from the show to let me know he got home safely (such a mom I know). Went to bed about 9:30 last night and I woke up this morning about 7ish. I was upset because Charles didn't call me so I decided I would wait for his call. He called me about 9:45 and the conversation went something like: Him- Hello. Me- Hi. How come you didn't call? Him- ::chuckle:: How did you sleep? Me- Hmmmm fine I guess but why didn't you call me? Him- I did about 11 and you were talking to me, thanked me for calling and thanked me for waking you up. As he was talking I looked at my received calls "Charles: 10:53pm". Now I know the lack of sleep dangers... I wonder if anyone else called and I made some outrageous promise. "Sure you can have my big toe. I have another one" "Who do I make my check out to?"

I can't believe I am already at work right now. I just dropped off Charles at the airport for his 6am flight to LA. He will be back on Tuesday. Last night we went to my parent's home. They are back from Montana finally! I got my Black Cats and couldn't wait to light some off. Abram and Asia had quite the assortment of fireworks. As soon as it was dark out Abram, Asia and I ventured to the backyard. I set off some Black Cats and it was greeeat! Boom, boom, boom! Then while Abram was lighting some of his Roman Candles, I lit Asia's sparklers. Then all of a sudden I hear Abram say 'Whooooa!' I look up and I see a trail of smoke and then all of a sudden... BOOM! It was like the fireworks for 4th of July. After that we quit because we got in trouble. Abram from my dad and me from Charles.

So as you now know I went to see Spiderman in the early morning hours of Wednesday. So that day I was running on about 4 hours sleep. I will never do that again. I was physically sick on Wednesday. Astlay ightnay, arleschay andyay Iyay ayedplay ayay amegay erewhay eway okespay inyay igpay atinlay. Esyay Iyay ealizeray eway on'tday avehay ayay ifelay. I don't know all the rules of pig latin. If I remember correctly each word ends in either yay or ay. I found a site that offers some of the urlLink basic rules : For words which begin with a single consonant take the consonant off the front of the word and add it to the end of the word. Then add ay after the consonant. Here are some examples: cat = atcay dog = ogday simply = implysay noise = oisnay For words which began with double or multiple consonants take the group of consonants off the front of the word and add them to the end, adding ay at the very end of the word. Here are some examples: scratch = atchscray thick = ickthay flight = ightflay grime = imegray For words that begin with a vowel, just add yay at the end. For example: is = isyay apple =appleyay under = underyay

I would have to say the French Dip is by far one of my favorite sandwiches. After work I went to the gym. While I was on the treadmill, this girl gets on one next to me. After being on the treadmill for about 15 minutes, she wiped her brow with the back of her hand and shook it off... something unforgivable happened next. A few drops landed on my arm...
